title: Can you still edit AlienFX?
body:
I'm sure im the only one who really cares about this matter, but I just snagged a alienware m17x for $400 dollars since I needed a new laptop, and noticed a new option left for me in the settings for league of legends. I turned it on and it works great. I was wondering if I could edit it as well. I did some digging into some really old posts and saw there was a file in which you could edit it, but I couldn't find it. I even searched the whole folder for it and it was unavailable along with some other trying searches. Was just wondering if the file is still there and is still able to edit because I would love to make my own light system for certain circumstances. I'm sure this isn't as much as a big deal as everything else is going on, and i'm sure i am the only one who cares about this since everyone else thinks Alienwares are trash :/. Just hit me up when you can please.
                                                                                                                                                                                            
 -WWR Swiff

replies.body: I'm sure it's probably still possible to get those files edited and working in a different way, but I'm not gonna have that info sadly. I'd suggest reaching out to Alienware's support since this is concerning their product.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EMcAZcVW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-11-14T03:40:14.808+0000)
>
> I'm sure it's probably still possible to get those files edited and working in a different way, but I'm not gonna have that info sadly. I'd suggest reaching out to Alienware's support since this is concerning their product.

I think you misunderstood what I said. The keyboard works fine, the Alienware product works perfectly fine. It lights up perfectly fine in game to specific moments. I was just wondering where the file is in the league of legends folder if it still is there. 

here is what the old post says: http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=65215

clearly that file location does not exists anymore, so where is that file?

I wanted to edit the color schematic for different colors than what they are now. The file must be somewhere since you still offer the AlienFX ability in the settings. so the code is there somewhere.

Yea sorry, I'm not super familiar with those files or how AlienFX worked since it came out so long ago (that post was from 2010).

I was able to do some quick google searches and found a little newer info. Again, not sure if this is still applicable or not. If this doesn't work any longer I'd consider reaching out to Alienware's support to see about getting this type of lighting function working again.

1. Go into C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
2. Open the game.cfg file (with something like wordpad)
3. Find the enablelightfx=0
4. change the enablelightfx=0 to enablelightfx=1

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EMcAZcVW,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-11-15T04:14:52.072+0000)
>
> Yea sorry, I'm not super familiar with those files or how AlienFX worked since it came out so long ago (that post was from 2010).
> 
> I was able to do some quick google searches and found a little newer info. Again, not sure if this is still applicable or not. If this doesn't work any longer I'd consider reaching out to Alienware's support to see about getting this type of lighting function working again.
> 
> 1. Go into C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
> 2. Open the game.cfg file (with something like wordpad)
> 3. Find the enablelightfx=0
> 4. change the enablelightfx=0 to enablelightfx=1

it's ok. I know that my LightFX is already enabled, I saw it at 1 already. I guess there might not be any way of editing it then anymore rip :/. Oh well thanks for the help anyways..

Yea, while I was searching everything that came up was from at least 4 years ago, so I'm thinking it might just not have any support at this point =\ . I'll keep searching a bit on the Alienware Forums when I can to see if anything turns up though!

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EMcAZcVW,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-11-16T04:55:08.758+0000)
>
> Yea, while I was searching everything that came up was from at least 4 years ago, so I'm thinking it might just not have any support at this point =\ . I'll keep searching a bit on the Alienware Forums when I can to see if anything turns up though!

thanks a lot! Yeah if you could add that feature back in when you have some time ya know, that would be great for all alienware users! :D
